column4: im having som difficulties with dbus. when i run e"nv | grep dbus" i get no output, but when i run "sudo /etc/init.d/dbus start" it says that dbus is already running, how can i fix it?
was `` e"nv `` a typo? I'm not familiar with that command...
if you meant "env", that isn't supposed to have any dbus lines in it, I think (my dbus works fine and env has nothing about dbus in it, anyway)
it should be "env"
try ps -AH | grep dbus
i have both launch and daemon there
iono, are you having dbus problems? if so, what errors are you getting?
Unhandled Exception: System.Exception: Unable to open the session message bus.
open a terminal and try dbus-launch banshee
i have banshee already running using that command, but the problem is that i cant control it remotely with example "banshee --pause"
my "echo $DBUS_SESSION_BUS_ADDRESS" gives me nothing though
does it persist after a restart? there's a launchpad bug that looks similar that got cleared up after a restart
you could also try "sudo /etc/init.d/dbus restart" i guess
i rebooted earlier, still the same error
hmm
i have no idea, then. Try asking in #dbus maybe?
i think i have it figured out. I run fluxbox, and there in lies the matter. it doesnt connect to dbus automaticcaly
if i close fluxbox, and start it up again via "dbus-launch" banshee works just like it should. Is there anyway to edit the script that runs when logging in?
If this were the Arch Linux IRC channel, I'd say to modify .xinitrc and put that command in there, but I don't know whether that's the Ubuntu Way of doing things.
what about .xsession?
which file did you put that in? so I know for future reference?
~/.fluxbox/startuo
thanks for your support too
